fields.description:
h3. Summary

The lucene index files location health check fails for BTRFS and probably other sub-volume file system mounts.
h3. Environment
 * Linux server
 * BTRFS sub-volume mounted

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Mount a BTRFS sub-volume
 # Configure JIRA to store index files on BTRFS volume mount
 # Run health check

h3. Expected Results

Health check is able to resolve the volume and validate conditions are met to pass the check, or fails based on conditions.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown displayed in the health check:
{noformat}
Exception during check invocation: java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.RuntimeException: java.io.IOException: Mount point not found
{noformat}
h3. Notes

It looks like there is an issue with Java and sub-volume mounts in linux which BTRFS supports. Here's an open issue describing the problem for OpenJDK:
 * [JDK-8165852 - (fs) Mount point not found for a file which is present in overlayfs - Java Bug System|https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8165852]

While OpenJDK is not supported by Atlassian, it appears that the Oracle Java impelmentation has the same issue as noted in this thread by Elasticsearch users seeing the same issue with BTRFS:
 * [unable to start elasticsearch on btrfs subvolume · Issue #14337 · elastic/elasticsearch · GitHub|https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/issues/14337]

The call that throws the exception is:
{code:java}
Files.getFileStore()
{code}
h3. Workaround

Move the JIRA home directory to a non sub-volume mounted file system.

There is also a BTRFS specific workaround mentioned in the Elasticsearch issue, but it is specific to their configuration and linux version.
fields.summary: Lucene index file location health check fails with java.io.IOException: Mount point not found

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA generates cache flush event for each default group after enabling Application access. These frequent cache flush put a lot of pressure to application as all threads needs to wait for the cache and especially together with JRA-64384 can make application unusable. Basically for each *addUserMembershipsForGroup* action JIRA flushes the cache.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add many groups and make then default for JIRA Software (same problem for ServiceDesk)
#* *Application access* page: [ Administration > Application > Application access] 
#*  !Application_access.png|thumbnail! 
# Create user 
# Enable debug logging for _com.atlassian.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager_
# Give user _Application access_
 !Edit_user_2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* JIRA adds user to groups. 
* None or one cache flush will be generated. 

h3. Actual Results
* JIRA will add user to groups.
* Many cache flush events generated, one for each added group (each group edit event generates the cache flush). 
* Check logs:
{noformat}
2017-03-15 18:19:41,883 http-nio-8081-exec-11 DEBUG admin 1099x2859x1 1tt78a8 127.0.0.1 /rest/internal/2/viewuser/application/jira-software [c.a.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager] Clearing the user counts on com.atlassian.crowd.event.group.GroupMembershi
pDeletedEvent.
2017-03-15 18:19:41,898 http-nio-8081-exec-11 DEBUG admin 1099x2859x1 1tt78a8 127.0.0.1 /rest/internal/2/viewuser/application/jira-software [c.a.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager] Clearing the user counts on com.atlassian.crowd.event.group.GroupMembershi
pDeletedEvent.
{noformat}
* Thread dump, thread trying to flush the cache: {{com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.LoadingCache.removeAll}}
{code:borderStyle=solid}
"http-nio-8080-exec-828" #365452 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007fda18083000 nid=0x38e0 waiting on condition [0x00007fde368df000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x000000055b994878> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock$FairSync)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.parkAndCheckInterrupt(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:836)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquireQueued(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:870)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.acquire(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:1199)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock$WriteLock.lock(ReentrantReadWriteLock.java:943)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.LoadingCache.removeAll(LoadingCache.java:320)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.DelegatingCache.removeAll(DelegatingCache.java:148)
	at com.atlassian.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager.clearUserCounts(DefaultApplicationRoleManager.java:651)
	at com.atlassian.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager.onGroupMembershipCreated(DefaultApplicationRoleManager.java:510)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor8945.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at com.atlassian.event.internal.SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.invoke(SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.java:36)
	at com.atlassian.event.internal.AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher$1$1.run(AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher.java:48)
	at com.google.common.util.concurrent.MoreExecutors$DirectExecutorService.execute(MoreExecutors.java:299)
	at com.atlassian.event.internal.AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher.dispatch(AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher.java:107)
	at com.atlassian.event.internal.EventPublisherImpl.invokeListeners(EventPublisherImpl.java:160)
	at com.atlassian.event.internal.EventPublisherImpl.publish(EventPublisherImpl.java:79)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.DirectoryManagerGeneric.addUserToGroup(DirectoryManagerGeneric.java:727)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.application.ApplicationServiceGeneric.addUserToGroup(ApplicationServiceGeneric.java:1297)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.CrowdServiceImpl.addUserToGroup(CrowdServiceImpl.java:711)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.DelegatingCrowdService.addUserToGroup(DelegatingCrowdService.java:193)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.FilteredCrowdServiceImpl.addUserToGroup(FilteredCrowdServiceImpl.java:324)
	at com.atlassian.jira.user.util.UserUtilImpl.doAddUserToGroup(UserUtilImpl.java:353)
	at com.atlassian.jira.user.util.UserUtilImpl.addUserToGroups(UserUtilImpl.java:367)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.user.DefaultUserService.addUserToApplication(DefaultUserService.java:608)
...
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.util.UpdateUserApplicationHelper.doApplicationUpdate(UpdateUserApplicationHelper.java:123)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.util.UpdateUserApplicationHelper.addUserToApplication(UpdateUserApplicationHelper.java:57)
	at com.atlassian.jira.rest.internal.v2.ViewUserResource.addUserToApplication(ViewUserResource.java:90)
{code}
 
h3. Notes
* Note related to this, quote from docs: https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/manage-group-access-to-applications-828787681.html
bq. We strongly recommend you only have one default group for each application. New users created and assigned application access are added to that application's default group ..
* JIRA will mark some groups as default after upgrade from 6.x to 7.x

Problem will be caused by combination of 2 factors:
* Too many cache flush events, current ticket
**  caused by allowing some user Application access
** For each default group there will be additional cache flush event when user is given _Application access_
* Slow cache population, see JRA-64384 
* Those two thread will fight for cache, meantime all threads will wait (this instability could be 5+ min), see related JRA-64847 
** one will flush
{code:borderStyle=solid}
"http-nio-8080-exec-828" #365452 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007fda18083000 nid=0x38e0 waiting on condition [0x00007fde368df000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
...
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.LoadingCache.removeAll(LoadingCache.java:320)
...
	at com.atlassian.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager.clearUserCounts(DefaultApplicationRoleManager.java:651)
{code}
**  another will populate:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
"http-nio-8080-exec-831" #365455 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007fda540a8800 nid=0x38e3 runnable [0x00007fde36485000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
..
	at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.DelegatingUserDao.processUsers(DelegatingUserDao.java:58).
...
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.LoadingCache.loadValueAndReleaseLock(LoadingCache.java:100)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.LoadingCache.get(LoadingCache.java:76)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.DelegatingCache.get(DelegatingCache.java:97)
	at com.atlassian.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager.getUserCount(DefaultApplicationRoleManager.java:407)
{code}

h3.Workaround
* Reduce number of default groups to 1. 

h5. Note on Fix
We largely mitigated the problem by implementing JRASERVER-65342, that makes cache flushes non-blocking, so they will not stack-up in case is many events.
fields.summary: JIRA generates cache flush event for each default group after enabling Application access

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Ctrl+c ctrl+v of PNG file in RTE  causes wrong content type being set in fileattachment DB row for pasted file. This can cause not rendering images on certain browsers (IE) due to wrong content type returned by com.atlassian.jira.web.servlet.ViewAttachmentServlet

Environment
 * JIRA 7.3.x

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # go to some issue
 # -drag and drop- ctrl+c ctrl+v some png file to the issue, it should be uploaded
 # copy the url from the uploaded file (from the view issue page)
 # use some tool to see headers of requested png file eq.
curl -v -u admin:admin [http://localhost:2990/jira/secure/attachment/10016/10016_image-2017-03-16-09-46-48-957.png] > test
gives:

{code:java}
< Content-Type: text/plain{code}
where it should be 
{code:java}
< Content-Type: image/png
{code}
 # Also in db there is wrong content type set:
 [^image-2017-03-16-11-39-49-837.png]
 # also when you copy paste the image url to new tab it will not render properly:
 [^image-2017-03-16-11-41-54-425.png]

h3. Expected Results

Content type should be set to proper one eg. image/png and image should be rendered correctly
h3. Actual Results

Content type for copy pasted png files is set to text/plain
h3. Workaround

use uploading from the menu (it seems to be working fine)
fields.summary: copy pasting png file into RTE causes wrong content type (text/plain) being set on attachment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64837].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Emails from JIRA platform are being rejected because the JIRA sending mail server has been blacklisted. Such SPAM blocklists include:
 * [SORBS|http://www.sorbs.net/]

Ask your email/security administrator to track incoming emails from JIRA. If affected, your mail filtering/service logs will confirm that emails from JIRA are being rejected for reasons related to blacklisting.

Example: 

!Rejection_Properties.png!

The way this information is displayed varies, but the log description should read similar to "IP Found in RBL".
h3. Environment

JIRA Infrastructure
h3. Expected Results

Emails are successfully delivered to the recipient.
h3. Actual Results

Emails are rejected by recipient server because the JIRA mail server was blacklisted.
 
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround. Contact support for information regarding your specific issue.
fields.summary: JIRA outgoing mail servers blacklisted on certain SPAM blocklists

h3. Summary
The manage attachment triangle options icon button can be selected but the list unable to be expanded. Expanding this with "Enter" key will open the list of details to manage attachments view and the attachments but cannot be highlighted by screen readers. Need to ensure this can be done with screen readers.

h3. Environment
* Chrome
* VoiceOver 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable VoiceOver in Mac
# Open Chrome and go to Issue view page
# Try to locate "Attachment" and choose the 'inverted triangle icon' to manage attachment view and list of attachments

h3. Expected Results
The list of attachment options can be selected by screen readers.

h3. Actual Results
The list of attachment options can be open using "Enter" key and selected using arrow keys but screen readers unable to 'speak' the list content.
fields.summary: Accessibility: Unable to manage attachments

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The delete attachment button is hidden until hovered. This causes an issue for screen readers because they're unable to focus on the action. Need to ensure this can be done with screen readers.

h3. Environment
* Chrome
* Scree readers eg. VoiceOver 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable VoiceOver in Mac
# Open Chrome and go to Issue view page
# Try to locate "Delete Attachment" for deleting Attachment using keyboard with assist of screen readers
#* Affecting both "thumbnails" and "list" view


h3. Expected Results
The _delete_ attachment button able to access/focus with keyboard

h3. Actual Results
The _delete_ attachment can only be selected if it is mouse hovered
 
h3. Workaround
# Go to $JIRA_INSTALL/ui/aui-layout/ directory and locate
#* issue-view.less.css
#* issue-view.less
# Update {{issue-view.less.css}} to remove 
{code:borderStyle=dashed}
.attachment-delete{visibility:hidden}
{code}
# Update {{issue-view.less}} to remove 
{code:borderStyle=dashed}
.attachment-delete {
     visibility: hidden;
 }
{code}
# Restart
fields.summary: Accessibility: Unable to delete an attachment

h3. Summary
When migrating the latest Server version the import is interrupted around 90% saying that JIRA is already setup, if the user continues to JIRA, they will see a 500 error and will not be able to continue any further.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Download the latest backup from Cloud (1000.824.2)
# Import into JIRA 7.3.3 (latest)

h3. Expected Results
The data should import correctly and allow the user to login.

h3. Actual Results
Accessing JIRA after the import results in a 500 error with the following stack trace:
{noformat}
java.lang.RuntimeException: javax.servlet.ServletException: java.lang.RuntimeException: javax.servlet.ServletException: com.atlassian.cache.CacheException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: No enum constant com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.api.DirectoryType.IDP
java.lang.RuntimeException: javax.servlet.ServletException: java.lang.RuntimeException: javax.servlet.ServletException: com.atlassian.cache.CacheException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: No enum constant com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.api.DirectoryType.IDP
	at com.atlassian.web.servlet.plugin.DynamicAuthorizationServletForwarder.forward(DynamicAuthorizationServletForwarder.java:55) [?:?]
	at com.atlassian.web.servlet.plugin.SanitizingServletForwarder.forward(SanitizingServletForwarder.java:32) [?:?]

	at jsp.default_jsp._jspService(default_jsp.java:68) [classes/:?]...

Caused by: com.atlassian.cache.CacheException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: No enum constant com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.api.DirectoryType.IDP
{noformat}

h3.Notes
The backup contains two user directories, the internal and the IDP. 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
<Directory id="1" directoryName="JIRA Internal Directory" lowerDirectoryName="jira internal directory" createdDate="2013-02-28 11:57:51.308" updatedDate="2016-01-06 16:25:09.931" active="1" description="JIRA default internal directory" implementationClass="com.atlassian.crowd.directory.InternalDirectory" lowerImplementationClass="com.atlassian.crowd.directory.internaldirectory" type="INTERNAL" position="0"/>

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Summary
I don't have too much information on this, however I am raising this in the event that it assists someone in the future regarding a similar problem.

The issue that was reported was that:  *importing from Redmine 2.6.1* with Microsoft SQL Server seemed to fail due to the use of {{smallint}} data type in the {{issue_statuses}} table. 

h3. Environment
Microsoft SQL Server
Redmine 2.6.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Using JIRA Importer Plugin, attempt to import issues from a Redmine database.

h3. Expected Results
The issues are expected to import without failure.

h3. Actual Results
The importer fails. An error occurred, but the exact details of the error are unknown at this time.

h3. Notes
This problem may be avoided by modifying the {{smallint}} data type to be {{bit}} data type in the issue_statuses table.
fields.summary: Importing from Redmine 2.6.1 and Microsoft SQL Server fails

fields.description:
I am getting this error when trying to import from bugzilla 3.4.4:
Unexpected failure occurred. Importer will stop immediately. Data maybe in an unstable state

with this in the log as last entry:
java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.Exception: Failed to add users to 'Developers' role for the project '...': Errors: {}
Error Messages: [The actor: 'zz_...' could not be found in any user directory. Therefore, it is not possible to add it to the project role

Bugzilla is not connected to Active Directory, users logins are configured manually as company email addresses. Jira is connected to AD (read-only).

The "actor" is a long gone user and of course i want to keep the information who reported/worked on issues in the past.

In AD the user still exists (disabled), his email address is present as user@corporate.com but his login was renamed to corporate\zz_user. In Bugzilla the login is user@corporate.com. In Bugzilla the realname is "Firstname Lastname", in AD the Display Name "Lastname, Firsname".
The Importer complains about zz_user, it must have that name from AD.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64819].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
It is currently not possible to choose whether to include or exclude users during imports from FogBugz On Demand in JIRA Cloud. As per the documentation on external import, this is a feature that is included:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/importing-data-from-fogbugz-on-demand-776636741.html

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud {{7.2.0-OD-05-030}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to _External System Import_: https://<instance name>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ExternalImport1.jspa
# Click on FogBugz On Demand
# The import wizard will be displayed. Key in FogBugz On Demand URL and credentials. Click _Next_.
# Select projects to  be included. Click _Next_.
# Select fields to be mapped. Click _Next_.
# Select values to be mapped. Click _Next_.
# Select links to be mapped. Click _Next_.


h3. Expected Results
One of the steps of the wizard to have an option to choose to import users or not.

h3. Actual Results
No option to include users during any of the stages. Please refer to the screen shots for each of the step.
 
h3. Notes
The importer is currently including users by default.

h3.Workaround
None at the moment.
fields.summary: Fogbugz OnDemand importer is not giving the option include or exclude users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64818].
  {panel}

Index may cause issue during [CSV import|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+issues+using+the+CSV+importer]. It happens when there is project with single issue type only and there is required custom field with Context set to that project. During manual creation is everything OK.

*Replication*
# Create new JIRA project, with exactly one issue type.
# Add new custom field. And restrict context for that issue type.
# In project Issue Field Configuration scheme set all fields to optional, except Sumary (It is mandatory to have it mandatory) and the new custom field.
# Create issue normally - it works
# Create issue by CSV import - Import fails because that field is always treated as null.

*Note:* Because there is only single issue type, import wizard do not offer Issue Type for mapping. My theory is that importer checks context before it actually applies issue type - automatically.

*Workaround:* Set context into project instead of Issue type.
fields.summary: CSV Import for restricted custom fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

I ran up JIM on JIRA 7.1.0-OD-02-025

I followed the docs on CAC and the "help suggestions" in the importer itself to have comments that retain their "created date"

My csv looks like


{noformat}
Summary, Assignee, Reporter, Issue Type, Description, Comment, Comment
"Test issue 1", admin, admin, 1, "Issue Description 1" ,  "01/01/2012 10:10:00; admin; This is comment 1"
"Test issue 2", admin, admin, 1, "Issue Description 2" ,  "01/01/2012 10:10:00; admin; This is comment 2.1", "01/01/2012 10:12:00; admin; This is comment 2.2"
{noformat}

however the comments get created as JUST now instead of in 2012

I get a comment like

 !image-2015-12-31-11-41-31-202.png|thumbnail! 

I did not change the suggested JIM date formats at all and left them as 

dd/MMM/yy h:mm a

The suggested help text from JIM does NOT match the actual format

{quote}
To preserve the comment author/date use format. E.g. "05/05/2010 11:20:30; adam; This is a comment."
{quote}

^ this is what JIM suggests when importing.  

I then changed the data to have the AM/PM indicator as suggested but it still does not work and I get the same result.

fields.description:
GreenHopper utilises JIM to generate a Sample Project. Certain fields of the project, for example {{projectName}} come from user input.

If the user inputs the project name "{{3 < 5}}", the resulting project will be named "{{3 & l t ; 5}}" (spaces removed).

This appears to be due to Velocity autoescaping the variables that come from our supplied Velocity context.

One way to get around this would be for JIM to allow us to specify if autoescaping should be on, or for which fields it should apply.
fields.summary: JIM JSON import autoescapes fields such as projectName

fields.description:
h5.summary

It's possible to create Issues with the type "Sub-task" that aren't associated with any parent.

h5.steps to reproduce
# create a CSV source file defining sub-tasks (populate _Parent Id_ and put "Sub-task" as the _Issue Type_);
# don't give sub-tasks a unique _Issue Id_, e.g. use the same string for all of them;
# perform the import.

*Result:* Issues are created, but not associated with any parent.

*Workaround:* this can be fixed by a CSV update. Edit the file to make _Issue Id_ values unique, and reimport the file.
fields.summary: CSV import can create sub-tasks without parents

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64808].
  {panel}

When import a csv without specifying the priority to a project where the priority is optional, the default value is not auto added when the issue was created. 

However, in the documentation it was mentioned that the first priority will be used as the priority of created issue if not specified:

{quote} If not specified in your CSV file, imported issues will be given the default (i.e. first) Priority as specified in your JIRA system  Defining 'Priority' Field Values. You can also create new JIRA values on-the-fly during the import process.
{quote}

Furthermore, it doesn't throw any exception or add the default value even and JIRA is not really to handle null priorities.

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Create a project
# Change its field configurations so 'priority' is optional
# Use CSV import to import a file where priority is not set

h2. Expected behavior
# Issues are imported and priority is set as default

h2. Actual behavior
# Issues are imported without priority

h2. Workaround:
*Workaround 1*
Search those issues that without priority and bulk edit them so that they will have priority.

*Workaround 2*
Change the field configuration in your project to have 'priority' as required before importing. You can change it back after the import.
fields.summary: Default priority value not added when it's not present in the csv file

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using a CSV import to update a moved issue, it incorrectly updates the project of the issue back to the original one causing duplicate issue Keys and viewing the issue is no longer possible.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Import or create an issue, for example MWK-1.
# Move issue to another project, in this example it becomes TECH-2. This can also involve changing things such as version and component, which are project-specific.
# CSV import the issue using the old key MWK-1.

h3. Expected Results

The TECH-2 issue is updated, using the data from MWK-1 (it will correctly find the issue using the {{moved_issue_key}} table).

h3. Actual Results

The issue key is moved back to the old project - for example TECH-2 is moved into the MWK project, and keeps the correct issuenum (3). Additionally, the below exception is thrown when attempting to view MWK-1, and TECH-2 will 404.

	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.DefaultIssueService.getIssue(DefaultIssueService.java:170) [DefaultIssueService.class:?]
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) [?:1.8.0_20]
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62) [?:1.8.0_20]
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) [?:1.8.0_20]
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:483) [?:1.8.0_20]
{noformat}

See [^full_stack_trace] for more info.

h3. Notes

Looking into the database we can see the problem is the project key is changed back to what it was. Prior to the import:

{noformat}
select * from jiraissue;
  id   | pkey | issuenum | project | reporter | assignee | creator | issuetype | summary | description | environment | priority | resolution
-------+------+----------+---------+----------+----------+---------+-----------+---------+-------------+-------------+----------+------------
 10000 |      |        1 |   10001 | admin    |          | admin   | 10005     | 1       |             |             | 3        |
 10002 |      |        2 |   10000 | admin    |          | admin   | 10001     | 2       |             |             | 3        |
 10003 |      |        3 |   10000 | admin    |          | admin   | 10001     | 3       |             |             | 3        |
 10001 |      |        2 |   10001 | admin    |          | admin   | 10005     | 1       |             |             | 3        |
(4 rows)
{noformat}

And after:

{noformat}
select * from jiraissue;
  id   | pkey | issuenum | project | reporter | assignee | creator | issuetype | summary | description | environment | priority | resolution
-------+------+----------+---------+----------+----------+---------+-----------+---------+-------------+-------------+----------+------------
 10000 |      |        1 |   10001 | admin    |          | admin   | 10005     | 1       |             |             | 3        |
 10002 |      |        2 |   10000 | admin    |          | admin   | 10001     | 2       |             |             | 3        |
 10003 |      |        3 |   10000 | admin    |          | admin   | 10001     | 3       |             |             | 3        |
 10001 |      |        2 |   10000 | admin    |          | admin   | 10001     | test    |             |             | 3        |
(4 rows)
{noformat}

The {{moved_issue_key}} table is not updated:

{noformat}
select * from moved_issue_key ;
  id   | old_issue_key | issue_id
-------+---------------+----------
 10000 | MWK-1         |    10001
(1 row)
{noformat}

h3. To check if you are affected:
Find duplicates by running:
{noformat}
SELECT i.id, (p.pkey || '-' ||  i.issuenum) AS issuekey, i.creator, i.created, i.summary from jiraissue i join project p  on i.project = p.id where (p.pkey || '-' ||  i.issuenum) = (SELECT (p.pkey || '-' ||  i.issuenum) from jiraissue i join project p  on i.project = p.id group by (p.pkey || '-' ||  i.issuenum) having count(1) > 1);
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

The issue cannot be accessed to be moved, unless through bulk edit. Then when moving the issue back to TECH, it will create a new issue key (such as TECH-3). MWK-1 will then not redirect to TECH-3 and anything linked to TECH-2 will break. As such a SQL update is needed. For example:

# Stop JIRA.
# Find the project were the issue was moved to by searching the history, replacing <issue_id> with the ids from the search to find duplicates:
{noformat}
select * from changeitem ci join changegroup cg on cg.id = ci.groupid where ci.field = 'project' and cg.issueid = <issue_id>;
{noformat}{noformat}
Example result:
  id   | groupid | fieldtype |  field  | oldvalue |  oldstring  | newvalue |  newstring  |  id   | issueid |  author  |          created
-------+---------+-----------+---------+----------+-------------+----------+-------------+-------+---------+----------+----------------------------
 40200 |   36300 | jira      | project | 10000    | OLD Project | 10500    | New Project | 36300 |   16115 | sysadmin | 2016-03-15 16:51:31.838-04
(1 row)
{noformat}
# Get the "newvalue". It corresponds to the project it was moved to.
# Update the issue to have the correct project:
{noformat}
update jiraissue set project = <newvalue> where id = <issue_id>
{noformat}
# Start JIRA and reindex.
fields.summary: CSV import changes project of moved issues back to the original creating duplicate issues and IllegalArgumentException

h5. Summary:
Importing issues from CSV via Issue dropdown menu fails to create values in custom field the way it works when user uses "External CSV import" via Administrator Page.

*Affects JIRA*: 6.3.X

h5. How to replicate:
# Create a CSV with a few sample data(you can use the sample attached).
# Create the custom fields that were listed in the CSV in your JIRA instance. Do not enter any data especially in 'Select List field', 'Radio Button' (should not contain same data as one that is in CSV) and all other fields that require user to add their options on creation.
# In the CSV add a user that is the reporter but does not exist in JIRA.
# Import the CSV via the Issue Drop down menu by selecting: " Import Issues from CSV"
# Associate the fields with their respective equivalents from the CSV(Don't select any match data).
# Select Begin Import and you should get an error similar the the one below:
!CSV Import Error.PNG|thumbnail!

If however you use the external CSV import, the issue would not occur because the fields will be created.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64788].
  {panel}

h4. +Scenario+
If a Redmine issue is Resolved and has a Resolution (custom field in Redmine), when it's imported into JIRA, JIRA will both:
# map this Resolution field to a custom field in JIRA
(i) it's not possible to map to the Resolution system field in JIRA as per JIM-1247
# automatically add a new option for the Resolution system field in JIRA and make it available to the imported issue

(x) The consequence is the imported issue has 2 Resolution fields holding different values

h4. +Steps to reproduce+
# in Redmine, create a custom field named Resolution
# open one Redmine issue and set the value of the Resolution field to Fixed, for example
# during Redmine import in JIRA, map this field to a custom field called Resolution in JIRA

h4. +Behaviors+
* (/) The Resolution custom field holds a Fixed value as per JIM-876
* (x) JIRA however interprets the Resolution value from Redmine incorrectly as *1* during the import:
!incorrectvalue.png|thumbnail!
* (x) This value is then created as an option for the Resolution system field:
!resolutionoption.png|thumbnail!
* (x) The imported issue then has 2 Resolutions:
!tworesolution.png|thumbnail!

h4. +Notes+
If it's possible to map a Redmine custom field to the Resolution system field in JIRA, this issue shouldn't happen. Implementing JIM-1247 should take this issue into account
fields.summary: Strange behavior of mapping a Resolution field when importing from Redmine

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA IMPORTER PLUGIN is not compatible with JIRA 6.2 as described on the [version history|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-importers-plugin/versions] page. At the moment an user updates the plugin, JIM will stop working.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Deploy a JIRA 6.2 instance;
# Go to the manage addons page and update JIM (it will be updated to the latest version 7.1.8).

h3. Expected Results
* To have the plugin updated properly and on a working status.

h3. Actual Results
The plugin is updated but it does not work.

h3.Solution / Workaround

To manually remove the plugin by:

# Stop JIRA;
# Remove *.jira-importers-plugin-7.1.8.jar from $JIRA_HOME/plugins/installed-plugins;
# Start JIRA
fields.summary: Version 7.1.8 not compatible with JIRA 6.2

fields.description:
*Multi-Select Field* does not get populated during CSV import. This problem is specific to the "Import Issues from CSV" function that is meant for end-users (Dashboard > Issues Dropdown > "Import Issues from CSV").  If using the method via Administration menu, that works fine.

(!) Note: this is *not* the same as the issue types bug that is mentioned here: JIM-1435. The problem occurs regardless of setting Issue Type in the field context.

h4. Reproduction Steps
* Create a multi-select type field
* Import a simple csv file
** example:  [^import-test.csv] 
* Import it via: *Dashboard > Issues Dropdown > "Import Issues from CSV"*
* Walk through the steps and map a field to the multi-select field
* Observe that issues are created without the multi-select field being populated

h4. Expected Result
User would expect that all issues are created with field values properly populated

h4. Actual Result
Import finishes with the following:
{code}
0 projects and 1 issues imported successfully!

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Date Modified field is set to the date of the import instead of the date specified in the CSV file when Epic Names/Links are being imported with an issue. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create CSV with at least the following fields: 
Summary, Epic Name, Epic Link,  Date Modified (for example see attached file)
# In the CSV create issues that will be attached to an Epic
# Use the External System Import Wizzard in JIRA to import CSV 

h3. Expected Results

Issues import with the Date Modified set to the value in the import CSV file.

h3. Actual Results

Issues imported with a  Date Modified set to date of import.
fields.summary: Date Modified Imports Current Date Instead Of The Date Specified When Epic Names/Links Are Attached To An Issue
JSON project "type" is required for jira 7 and not marked as ignorable for older

fields.description:
h3. Summary
CSV Import will automatically add user to the Developer role whether the role exists or not

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Delete the Developer Role from JIRA.
 # Confirm to delete the role when being reminded.
 # The permission scheme will remove Developer role from the permissions.
 # Create a Test Project.
 # Navigate to _JIRA Administration > System > External System Import_ and choose CSV Import.
 # Import the [^AtlassianTestCSV (1).csv] and choose the previous Test project as the target project.
 # Finish the Import.

h3. Expected Results
The issue is imported without any problem and the assignee field will used what have been specified in the CSV file.

h3. Actual Results
Same as the expected result above, but will be creating the Developer Role in the process and included those user inside.

h3. Workaround
The unprivileged importer available at *Issues > Import issues from CSV* does not cause the *Developers* project role to be recreated.

h3. Notes
While the user who are assigned to those issue will stays even without having _"Assignable User"_ permission, the user would be included in the Developer Role which also does not have the permission.

This should not be a problem if there is only several user on the CSV file, but if importing hundred of issues with unique users could lead to a problem where it would not possible to access Project People/Roles due to amount of users int that role.
fields.summary: CSV Import will automatically add user to the Developer role whether it exists or not

When importing a sub-task via CSV, you should require a reference to the parent issue.
If you try to import the CSV via _Issues > Import Issues from CSV_, that validation is done, however when importing through _Administration > System > External System Import_ the CSV import creates orphan sub-tasks.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a CSV with only a sub-task to be created, with no parent issue specified
# Import CSV using External System Import

*Expected Behaviour*
A warning message saying "Subtask 'Issue' doesn't have a valid Parent Id selection. Issue will not be created." should be displayed (as it is on "Import Issues from CSV")

*Actual behaviour*
Issue is created successfully without a parent
fields.summary: CSV import allow orphan sub-task via External System Import

fields.description:
We have a custom field (called "Issue Owner") of the userpicker type.  When importing from CSV, the same username will be supplied for reporter, assignee and the 'issue owner" field.  The report and assignee fields will populate correctly, however "issue owner" will be empty in the newly created issue consistently across all our issue types and workflows.

For the workflow that has a validator to ensure the user selected in this custom field is in at least one of the roles of the project, we see the related error that they are not in one of the roles in the importer detailed log and the issue is not created.  Otherwise there are no obvious errors listed to indicate the issue.
fields.summary: CSV Input with userpicker custom field not populating properly

fields.description:
When the end user tries to import issues from issues > Import Issues From CSV the option "Time Spent" does not appear. This option does appear when importing issues from System > External System Import
Is there a way to modify that so the end user can import issues with time spent already loaded?
Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: End users don't have the option "Time Spent" to map when importing from CSV

On second try it all just worked but most of users were already created...

It's possible that it's crowd performance problem, but it's hard to say without further investigation.

fields.description:
I'm guessing that there's a way to accumulate time on a JIRA item, but I'm not getting it. I started with the example CSV given in the help pages:

Summary,Worklog
Only time spent (one hour),3600
With a date and an author,2012-02-10 12:30:10;wseliga;120
With an additional comment,Testing took me 3 days;2012-02-10 12:30:10;wseliga;259200

And I adopted it to work as three updates to my own sample project as follows:

Issue Key,Project Name,Project Key,Summary,Worklog
TEST-34,Test project,TEST,,3600
TEST-34,Test project,TEST,,20130210123010;mbrown;120
TEST-34,Test project,TEST,,Testing took me 3 days;20130211123010;mbrown;259200

The intent here is to have all three lines update a single JIRA item, TEST-34, in my project named "Test project". I had to adjust the date/time strings to match my desired format, but that was minor. Everything worked correctly except that the overall Time Spent on TEST-34 was 72 Hours, rather than 73 Hours 2 Minutes as expected. (3600 + 120 + 259200 should add to 73 hours 2 minutes, but instead the last entry of 295200 just forced the total time to 72 hours.)

Here is the CSV mapping file I used. You'll note that the worklog column is mapped to field.worklog, not to Time Spent. Out of curiosity, how many fields can go into the Worklog column separated by semi-colons?

{
 "field.Project Name" : "project.name",
 "date.import.format" : "yyyyMMddHHmmss",
 "field.Worklog" : "worklog",
 "field.Issue Key" : "issuekey",
 "field.Project Key" : "project.key",
 "user.email.suffix" : "@medaptus.com",
 "mapfromcsv" : "true",
 "field.Summary" : "summary"
}

A bug is happening on import of projects from Bitbucket to JIRA. When issues are imported to a JIRA project, their issue types are requested, as the image below shows:
!mapping_importing_issues_bitbucket_jira.png!

The available issue types are not the ones in the project’s ‘Issue Type Scheme’ and when selected an issue type that is not one of the types available for the project, an error occurs.

!error_importing_bitbucket.png!
It reads ‘Error importing issue ExternalIssue{externalId=1, summary=Test issue, issueType=1}’

*Steps to reproduce*
* Create a project in JIRA that does not contain all issue types
* Create a project in BitBucket and create issues
* Import the project in Bitbucket to the project in JIRA
* Map some issue types (with existent issues in BitBucket) in the project to types that are not mapped to the project
* Begin import
* The error will occur

*Workarounds*
* Check carefully the types to make sure no type is mapped to unmapped types in the project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you try to import from Trello, but a *list* you have in Trello has a name longer than 60 characters, the import will fail and in such a way that you don't even get the normal error rendering, instead the stack trace is just displayed unadorned. *Status* field in JIRA has 60 characters limit and Trello's *list* field that is imported into that field exceeds the limit.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup Trello such that you have a list with a name longer than 60 characters.
{code:java}This is my example see that it has just one extra character..{code}

 # Attempt to Import in to JIRA

h3. Expected Results

Import proceeds normally to JIRA
h3. Actual Results

This error is displayed on screen (but not the usual nicely formatted error):
 !trello_import_failure.png|thumbnail!

This exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file (for PostgreSQL):
{noformat}Caused by: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:Status][sequence,18][statuscategory,1][name,This is my example see that it has just one extra character..][iconurl,/images/icons/statuses/generic.png][description,][id,10112] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO public.issuestatus (ID, SEQUENCE, pname, DESCRIPTION, ICONURL, STATUSCATEGORY) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (ERROR: value too long for type character varying(60)))
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.singleInsert(GenericDAO.java:213)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.insert(GenericDAO.java:178)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericHelperDAO.create(GenericHelperDAO.java:83)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.create(GenericDelegator.java:556)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.create(GenericDelegator.java:542)
        at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.createValue(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:296)
        ... 331 more
Caused by: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO public.issuestatus (ID, SEQUENCE, pname, DESCRIPTION, ICONURL, STATUSCATEGORY) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (ERROR: value too long for type character varying(60))
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor.executeUpdate(SQLProcessor.java:683)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.singleInsert(GenericDAO.java:205)
        ... 337 more
Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: value too long for type character varying(60)
        at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.receiveErrorResponse(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2101)
        at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.execute(QueryExecutorImpl.java:255)
        at org.postgresql.jdbc2.AbstractJdbc2Statement.execute(AbstractJdbc2Statement.java:510)
        at org.postgresql.jdbc2.AbstractJdbc2Statement.executeWithFlags(AbstractJdbc2Statement.java:386)
        at org.postgresql.jdbc2.AbstractJdbc2Statement.executeUpdate(AbstractJdbc2Statement.java:332)
        at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingPreparedStatement.executeUpdate(DelegatingPreparedStatement.java:98)
        at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingPreparedStatement.executeUpdate(DelegatingPreparedStatement.java:98)
        at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor.executeUpdate(SQLProcessor.java:673)
        ... 338 more
{noformat}
Also checked with MySQL which has a slightly different error:
{noformat}Caused by: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:Status][sequence,94][statuscategory,1][name,Eric idea: sectioning the ed. board could help with curated lists][iconurl,/images/icons/statuses/generic.png][description,][id,11740] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO issuestatus (ID, SEQUENCE, pname, DESCRIPTION, ICONURL, STATUSCATEGORY) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (Data truncation: Data too long for column 'pname' at row 1)){noformat}
h3. Notes

Tested in JIRA 7.1.4 with JIRA Importers Plugin 7.1.6 and jira-importers-trello-plugin 1.5.1 as well as JIRA 7.2.3 with JIRA Importers Plugin 7.1.25 and jira-importers-trello-plugin 2.0.2
h3. Workaround

Alter Lists in Trello before importing so that the names are all shorter than 60 characters.
fields.summary: Trello import with list names greater than 60 characters fail

fields.description:
An initial import is created with a selection of fields checked on the right-hand side for retained settings, i.e. 'Issue Type', 'Priority'. 'Severity'.

Additional map field selections that were not checked will appear in the 'CSV-configuration' file that is produced at the end of an import.

The impact of this issue is reusing the configuration file selects mappings users did not want to retain.  I have been able to replicate this behaviour when the JIRA field was a custom field.

Cheers,
Paul
fields.summary: Saved configuration file retains mappings that were unselected

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64747].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
CSV importer doesn't import *Select List (cascading)* field data correctly.
This problem happens only when we use {{Issues}} > {{Import Issues from CSV}} on the top page.
This problem never happens when we import CSV with using {{System}} > {{External System Import}} in Administration page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project
# Add *Select List (cascading)* custom field and set their options
# Associate the custom field to the project you created on step1
# Import CSV (See example file) from {{Issues}} > {{Import Issues from CSV}}

h3. Expected Results
The CSV data should be imported to JIRA correctly.

h3. Actual Results
*Select List (cascading)* custom field data (especially the child option) wasn't imported. (See following screenshot)
!cascading.png|thumbnail!
 
h3.Workaround
Use {{System}} > {{External System Import}} in Administration page instead.
fields.summary: CSV importer doesn't import 'Select List (cascading)' field data correctly

Several JIRA Issues that I have analyzed exhibit the problem where selecting the 'Transitions' tab does not list all transitions

|Resolved	|Resolved		|Verified	|Verified|

|Closed	|Closed		|Closed	|Closed|


See the old transition are not listed in the above table.

Regards,
Tushar
